main.name: Kelly Jung
main.description: Finding creative approaches, while working through the full life cycle of development projects, is what I do. I'm always eager to learn new technologies and expand myself as an developer, but I especially enjoy UI/UX work and creating intuitive software made for the best user experience.
main.bio: Originally from the suburbs of New York City, I hopped over to St. Louis to attend college and have been living here since. In 2017, I participated in a summer coding fellowship and now am developing a career in tech. I'm always looking for ways to expand my horizons in this industry and learn new technologies. Below you can learn more about my experience!

positions.title: Software Enginner
positions.description: LACRM is designed specifically for small businesses and strives to focus on giving its customers what they really need to manage their business. My team is comprised of well-rounded software engineers, but we fall into our own niches.Â I like to get a little creative, so I've picked up many front-end projects, altering the entire outlook of our product. I have developed a passion for UI/UX design and am continuing to find places where we can make improvements to our CRM. I also contribute to altering our back-end to implement new features and aide our customers with their CRM needs by providing technical support and developing solutions for any software bugs.

positions.title: CRM Coach / Junior Software Engineer
positions.description: I started working at LACRM on a rotational basis. While as a CRM Coach, I continued to develop my coding skills by on smaller-scale web development projects. Coordinating with our web designer, I took mock ups and brought them to reality. During this time, I also really familiarized myself with PHP and MySQL, as I altered our internally-used CMS and public facing site. Being on the support team allowed me to really understand our customer base and their software wants.

positions.title: Coding Fellow
positions.description: LACRM Coding Fellowship aims to teach coding skills to people from underrepresented groups in tech in order to promote diversity in the industry. The fellowship aims to prepare individuals for careers in tech. I was proud to be part of the first class of fellows here, and by the end, I had drastically improved my coding skills, enough for me to seamlessly transition into a full-time role after rotating for a few months.

experience.company: Washington University in St. Louis Career Center

positions.title: Career Peer (Student Advisor Intern)
positions.description: The Career Peers are a team of students who meet 1:1 with fellow students on a walk-in basis to help with anything in the career development, from resume writing to interviewing and networking skills. As a Career Peer, I was also the front-face of the Career Center, communicating with advisors, employers, and students to direct and provide answers for any questions pertaining to the center.

resume.skillmessage: Always learning, always improving! But at the moment, these are my skills.
